content.description: Stand start with a left sidepull and a right hand high at the start of the longer crack. Pull yourself up, and work your way to the first shelf before sending a fun topout.
content.location: This boulder is located only ~25 feet off trail to your left, on the way to Crouching Tiger Boulder from the parking lot. This side of the boulder is not clearly visible from the trail; however, the downclimb can be seen.

content.description: This is the stand start on the west side of the boulder face. Stand start matching both hands on the sloper shelf. Work your way up using a few nice pockets and additional sloped shelves.

Stand start on slopey crimps to the right of Lance and the left of Pioneer Club. A good gaston for the left gets your right to a rounded sidepull/undercling flake. Gain the good edge below the right-trending flake with your left, and top out using the juggy flake.
content.location: This climbs the face between the problems Lance and Pioneer Club on the main face of the Lagoon Boulder.

content.description: Climb up the gentle, lightning-shaped crack on the slab. This also serves as a downclimb.
content.location: It is on the slab side of the boulder.

content.description: This is an incredibly balancy and fun boulder that will test your technique instead of your strength. Match your hands on a big, round jug at head height. Pull on, and change to a mantel. Use small rock features such as crimps, thumb catches, or a low, triangular pinch until you can stand up completely and reach the top of the boulder. My friend who climbed it is only 5 feet tall, so donâ€™t use height as your excuse. The top of the boulder is juggy, and the topout is easy.
content.protection: At least 1 pad and a spotter is recommended!
content.location: The starting jug is to the right of Pioneer Club and to the left of Black Lagoon. There is no elimination, use all the holds you can find!

content.description: Just around the corner from Lance, climb the slab using the vertical seams and a mid-height shelf.
content.location: Just left of Lance, start squeezed in front of small oak tree.

content.description: Sit start and move left and up the steep arete.
content.location: This climbs the obvious, steep arete.

content.description: Start standing with your left hand on a chest-height rounded jug and your right hand on a sloper. Work your hands and feet up the shelf, and latch the slopey crimp up higher. Top out on jugs.
content.location: It is in between Black Lagoon and Cashew Lagoon.

content.description:
This is a good-sized boulder located at the edge of a swamp/lagoon. Around 20 feet off the path south of the Crouching tiger boulder.

 F12 on the Lynn woods Caltopo map.
